intro: Pimpinella oliverioides, commonly known as the lesser cow-weed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. The seeds are small and covered in a fine, hairy coating, aiding in their dispersal by wind or animals.
